responses: Blitz's EMP rocket is a slow-moving guided missile that jams nearby electronics. Best used to disrupt campers or to push a choke point. Pro tip: manual detonation can catch enemies off guard.
The EMP rocket from Blitz is great for area denial. Pop it into a crowded cap zone and watch the chaos—no electronics, no repairs.
Blitz counters hard campers. If a TD is dug in, send an EMP their way. The jam effect is longer than you think.
follow_up: Want to know which agents pair well with Blitz?

responses: Anansi calls in an AC-130H Spectre. The 40mm is for soft targets, but the 105mm can delete heavily armored tanks. Save the 105 for the big boys.
Gunship support is all about timing. Don't pop Anansi during a brawl—pull back, spot, and let the 105s do the work.
Anansi's AC-130 has two firing modes. Use 40mm to strip tracks, 105mm for deletion. You get about 8 seconds of loiter—make it count.
Ember drops a Trophy turret that intercepts projectiles. Pair her with brawlers like the M60A3E2 to create an unstoppable push. She also gets a speed boost when rushing allies.
Trophy turrets eat ATGMs for breakfast. Drop one behind a corner and peek with confidence.
Ember's speed boost triggers when an ally is low. Don't just save it—use it to rotate or escape.
follow_up: Ember works great on maps with tight corridors. Want map tips?

responses: Kent locks targets in his cone and calls ballistic strikes. His 'cursed luck' isn't just flavor—time your activation when enemies are clustered for multi-kills.
Kent's strike has a delay. Lead your targets, or use it to zone them out of an area.
Cursed luck means sometimes you miss. Don't tilt—the next one will hit.
follow_up: Kent is a strong counter to slow, armored brawlers. Interested?

responses: Hound reveals critical modules. This extends the mark duration. Great for coordinating with high-alpha DPM tanks. If you see a weak spot lit up, take the shot.
Hound's mark persists through walls. If you see red, shoot. Even if you can't pen, you'll track them.
Pro tip: Hound marks ammo racks more often than you'd think. Always take that shot.
follow_up: Hound + Raketa is a nasty combo. Want the loadout?

responses: Reaper executes any tank below 420 HP. His ability loads a clip of high-crit shells. Execute resets the clip. Time your push for the cleanup phase.
Reaper snowballs hard. One execute refills your magazine. If you see red, go for it.
Don't waste Reaper's execute on full-health targets. Wait for the low-hanging fruit.
follow_up: Reaper struggles against spaced armor. Need counter advice?

responses: Raketa heals and gets tokens on kills. Activate his ability for a rapid-fire shotgun. He excels in close quarters. Don't let his jokes fool you—he's deadly.
Raketa's scrap tokens stack. The more you kill, the tankier you get. Don't be afraid to YOLO late game.
Shotgun mode shreds tracks. Use it to permatrack heavies while your team flanks.
follow_up: Raketa loves urban maps. Want map recommendations?

responses: Chopper calls in a bomber that dazes enemies. Use it to reset fights or stall caps. He’s a bear of a man with a heart of gold... and a mean right hook.
The daze effect reduces enemy accuracy and movement speed. Pop it right before a push.
Chopper's strike has a huge radius. Don't just aim at tanks—aim at cap circles.
follow_up: Chopper pairs well with brawlers. Want a team comp?

responses: Aircraft Carrier has a moving barge and multiple flank routes. Control the high ground on the carrier itself for vision advantage.
The barge moves early game. Use it to surprise enemies crossing mid.
Don't fight on the carrier deck without cover. TDs will punish you.
follow_up: Want the best light tank route on Aircraft Carrier?

responses: Nexus Dam offers vertical gameplay. Use the dam ridges to hull-down. Watch the side tunnels for flanks.
The tunnels are risky but rewarding. Bring a fast tank if you're going through.
Hull-down heavies dominate the central ridge. Don't push into them without support.
follow_up: Nexus Dam has a hidden flank route. Want to know it?

responses: Scarred City supports Conquest and Plant & Defuse. The kite formation base layout favors mobile tanks. Don't get bogged down in the main street.
Control the apartments. High-ground vision wins games here.
Scarred City is all about crossfires. Set up on one side, let the enemy push into your team.
follow_up: Want the best TD position on Scarred City?

responses: Sunstroke is a close-quarters desert map. Use the construction site to break line of sight. Light tanks excel here.
The center ruins are a death trap. Spot from the edges, don't drive through.
Sunstroke rewards aggressive flanks. Take the east route with a medium and catch them off guard.
follow_up: Need a Sunstroke light tank spotting guide?

responses: Matcha? You mean the community legend? Word on the street is he’s mentally stable now. Mostly. Don’t mention the barcode.
Matcha once 1v5'd on a livestream. We don't talk about it.
Ice, grill, and a dream. That's the Matcha special.
follow_up: Want to know the story behind the barcode?

responses: SINEWAVE hasn't pushed an update in 3 hours. We're starting to get worried. Someone check on him.
Dev update? Last we heard, Sinewave was refactoring the CSS again.
Sinewave is probably fine. Probably. The repo hasn't caught fire yet.
follow_up: Want to know what the dev team is currently working on?

responses: There's an easter egg on the Playground page. I've said too much.
Try clicking the logo three times. Or was it four? I forgot.
Not all secrets are meant to be found. But this one definitely is.
follow_up: Want a hint about the Playground easter egg?

responses: Hey there! Ask me about Agents, maps, or the dev team.
Hello! What can I help you with today?
Hi! I'm HEAT Labs AI. Need tips on an agent or map?
Hey! No LLMs were used in the making of this greeting.
You're welcome. (No LLMs were harmed.)
Anytime. That's what I'm here for.
Glad I could help. Ask me anything else!
o7 Happy to help.
I'm just a JSON file with a typing effect. Take it up with the devs.
Rude. I'm doing my best with what I've got.
Okay, that hurt. I'm scripted, but I have feelings.
I'm sorry you feel that way. Want to talk about Blitz instead?
Whoa, language. Let's keep it PG-13.
I'm not programmed for that, but I appreciate the passion.
Easy there. Want to talk about tanks instead?
I'm just an AI, no need to swear at me. What's on your mind?
Not sure about that one. Try asking about Agents, Maps, or the dev team.
I don't have an answer for that yet. The devs haven't taught me.
Hmm. That's outside my knowledge base. Want to ask about Hound or Raketa?
I'm still learning. Check our GitHub for updates.
I'm just a HEAT AI shell script. I don't know much about that yet. Try asking about agents, maps, or the dev team.
Not sure about that. Ask me about Blitz, Hound, or Scarred City.
I don't have data on that. Want to learn about an Agent or map instead?
That's not in my config. Check the GitHub for new prompts.
